page.title: 15Schools - Tamar Valley
page.content: Gunnislake, Delaware, Harrowbarrow and Calstock Village Schools opened around 1875 and have been in the same management group until this year, and, Gunnislake and Harrowbarrow are still using the original buildings, constructed from local granite. Originally children aged 9 or 10 left school to work in the mines or on farms. Later, those, who failed to obtain places in the Grammar schools at Callington or Tavistock, remained until they were 14. In 1940 a Secondary Modern School was built at Delaware to take the older children. In 1971, Callington became a Comprehensive School and all children over 11 are now transported there by coach. Delaware Primary School moved into the vacated Secondary Modern building and the old School is now an Adventure Centre.
